intro: Senecio erucifolius var. lyratus, commonly known as the lyrated everlasting. It is a flowering plant native to South Africa, characterized by its distinctive, elongated, and often curly leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage and prolonged flowering period.
